channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Carl Icahn is urging BlackRock and other big index-fund managers focused on socially conscious investing to support his proxy fight at McDonald’s for better treatment of pregnant pigs https://t.co/PIiwKI0AqK

Japan should aim to nearly double its defense spending over the next five years to 2% of gross domestic product and ease restrictions on arms exports, a ruling-party panel said Thursday, citing threats from China. https://t.co/pOZgOhmnab

France issued an international arrest warrant for former Renault chief Carlos Ghosn, alleging he funneled millions of euros from the auto maker, people familiar with the matter say https://t.co/77u9iyBwcE
Kaitlyn Younger applied to five Ivy League schools, plus Stanford and Berkeley, with a 1550 on her SAT. None accepted her. https://t.co/TAmGGOeVFR
Meta’s Sheryl Sandberg pressured the Daily Mail to shelve a potential article about her then-boyfriend, Activision Blizzard’s Bobby Kotick, said people involved in the matter https://t.co/eoEfor6DUh
He was a longtime driver at Moscow’s police headquarters. Then he spoke up about the War in Ukraine. Now he faces the potential of 10 years in jail. https://t.co/JH02SLE4fI
Mattel released a Queen Elizabeth II Barbie doll to commemorate the royal’s seven-decade reign https://t.co/3W3zsczJFL
They don’t just win. They crush souls. The Oklahoma Sooners of college softball are 39-1–and send most opponents home early. Sports columnist @JasonGay on a school powerhouse. https://t.co/eCTmVh42Kn

Elon Musk said Tesla could boost vehicle production more than expected this year despite supply-chain bottlenecks and disruptions in China, as the electric car maker posted a sevenfold increase in first-quarter profit https://t.co/z5JAMXoA7t

Billionaire investor William Ackman said his hedge fund sold its stake in Netflix Wednesday, implying a loss of about $400 million, as the shares recorded their biggest one-day drop since 2004 https://t.co/7snPGqML5u
Disney is set to lose its special tax district after a Florida vote. It let the company govern the land housing its theme parks for over 50 years. https://t.co/l1r8APrwa6

Thirteen women sexually assaulted by former USA Gymnastics doctor Larry Nassar after he was reported to the FBI in 2015 have filed claims against the agency over its failure to follow up on the allegations https://t.co/UboX7dxcSk
Recreational marijuana sales in New Jersey mark the first time cannabis is legally available for nonmedical purposes in the New York City and Philadelphia regions https://t.co/NPs6mpJ43t
An opaque market is forming to obscure the origin of Russia's oil as more shipping tankers are loaded without a precise destination https://t.co/gnYeTA7Mng

U.S. home prices hit a record of $375,300 in March and analysts expect prices to climb even more, despite higher mortgage rates pushing some buyers out of the market #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/z1W1SMwBi3 https://t.co/0vSfIRlZKQ

President Biden said Thursday the U.S. would send roughly $800 million in additional military aid to Ukraine, as Russian forces tightened their grip on the strategically important port city of Mariupol https://t.co/s1nJelLNVo
Breaking: Elon Musk said he has commitments for $46.5 billion in funding to finance his offer to buy Twitter https://t.co/yoz64xEY5c
U.S. relations with longtime ally Saudi Arabia have reached the breaking point. The risk for Washington is that Riyadh will align more closely with China and Russia. https://t.co/hMhhRqMk59
Russian President Vladimir Putin oversaw the first test-launch of an intercontinental ballistic missile that he said would make those threatening his country “think twice” https://t.co/Djxll0BsDC

The Florida Senate passed a bill that would eliminate a special tax district that has allowed Disney to govern the land where its theme parks sit, as lawmakers target the company for opposing the state’s so-called “Don’t Say Gay” law https://t.co/zX1TO3t4z8

Florida Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis is seeking to end Walt Disney World’s special tax district. He previously clashed with the company over its opposition to the state’s new education legislation, dubbed the “Don’t Say Gay” bill by critics. #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/OxpaIk7spX https://t.co/y3ra909hX6

Bill Ackman, the billionaire investor whose fund Pershing Square bought more than three million shares of Netflix in January, said Wednesday that it had sold its stake in the company at a loss https://t.co/dShhdfP7yN

Netflix shares were on track for their biggest fall in nearly a decade after the streaming platform reported it lost subscribers and said it was looking to offer a cheaper, ad-supported version #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/UnZk3SCxJv https://t.co/1y0uDKEBBS

Wimbledon, the world’s oldest Grand Slam tennis tournament, will ban players from Russia and Belarus from competing there this summer in the sports world’s latest response to the invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/tR6uRsDZ0N

The Florida Senate passed a bill that would eliminate a special tax district that has allowed Disney to govern the land where its theme parks sit, as lawmakers target the company for opposing the state’s so-called “Don’t Say Gay” law https://t.co/8QjBZwZRij
Netflix stock plunged 30%, putting it on course for its worst day in nearly a decade https://t.co/AjAS5UR9V7

Twitter co-founder Jack Dorsey took a vague swipe at the company’s board and seemingly endorsed criticism of a core feature on the platform, appearing to align himself with Elon Musk against the company https://t.co/iP66e29iaG
Afghans are selling their organs or family members’ to stave off hunger and pay off debts. “No father wants to sell his son’s kidney.” https://t.co/zUntrDBdT1
Ukraine’s government said it enlisted a group of social-media posters to shame companies still doing business in Russia https://t.co/LTgPq505wT
China says it has signed a security pact with the Solomon Islands, confirming an arrangement that in its draft form drew objections from the U.S. and Australia https://t.co/huFddKzfq4
U.S. relations with longtime ally Saudi Arabia have reached the breaking point. The risk for Washington is that Riyadh will align more closely with China and Russia. https://t.co/j0WG8jdLvg
Why the besieged port city of Mariupol, whose defenders have frustrated Moscow’s troops, matters so much for Russia and Ukraine https://t.co/DPF2vXGU6K
U.S. relations with longtime ally Saudi Arabia have reached the breaking point. The risk for Washington is that Riyadh will align more closely with China and Russia. https://t.co/RB3GLed1ZG
From @WSJopinion: Is it the end of Russia’s empire? Moscow has a stake in the Ukraine war that is greater than Putin’s career, writes @wrmead https://t.co/Pb0RXheBy0
The White House said Tuesday that the Justice Department is still weighing whether to appeal the ruling striking down the mask mandate for public transportation https://t.co/USKckRRJFv
Ukraine’s government said it enlisted a group of social-media posters to shame companies still doing business in Russia https://t.co/3Mk8lJ7JtO
As investors buy more houses than ever to rent out, homeowners are rewriting the rules to stop them https://t.co/dF44BrtbcY
Breaking: Netflix lost 200,000 global subscribers in the first quarter and expects to lose 2 million more this spring. Shares fell 17% after hours. https://t.co/91Q5iNj4L2
U.S. relations with longtime ally Saudi Arabia have reached the breaking point. The risk for Washington is that Riyadh will align more closely with China and Russia. https://t.co/jjYziE56nA
Air France and Lufthansa still require masks on board, while British Airways and KLM say it depends on the destination https://t.co/6Cq9YH1a4G
Kyiv’s successful use of internet to counter Moscow highlights Taiwan’s reliance on undersea internet cables that China could cut https://t.co/qnZunoGkrj

Florida Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis asked the state’s legislature on Tuesday to consider ending special tax districts established before 1968, including one that effectively lets Disney govern the land its theme parks are built on https://t.co/dl4Q3IGl2c

The Biden administration is restoring stricter environmental standards for approving new pipelines, highways, power plants and other construction projects, including requiring consideration of how such projects might affect climate change https://t.co/6SigZIfqli

Videos shared online show plane passengers cheering after a judge’s decision to throw out a public-transport mask mandate, while the White House recommended people still wear masks on planes, trains and buses #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/oCVhFoH59F https://t.co/avvusSEALT
The U.S. mask mandate on airplanes, taxis and other forms of public transit has been thrown out by a federal judge who said said it exceeded the authority of the CDC https://t.co/0zdWJZfBGO
Missiles hit Lviv in western Ukraine, killing six, Ukrainian officials said, in a sign Russia's weapons remain a threat far from the conflict's front lines https://t.co/ogaMrobjWV

Elon Musk, a self-described “free-speech absolutist,” said that Twitter is the “de facto town square,” and that “it’s very important for there to be an inclusive arena for free speech.” Here's what else he has planned. https://t.co/VHxf9O3kwx
“The light is killing me—it’s my main enemy here.” Spending weeks with thousands of strangers under 24/7 fluorescent lights: this is life in a Shanghai mass quarantine center. https://t.co/j1o8PDtEo8
Breaking: The U.S. mask mandate on airplanes, taxis and other forms of public transit was thrown out by a federal judge who said said it exceeded the authority of the CDC https://t.co/rjxKnuCYMd
Russia is tightening its hold over occupied areas of southern Ukraine, installing pro-Moscow leaders, hunting for dissenters and dismantling Ukrainian state institutions https://t.co/TXjDZhnZOY
